definition: First Sino-Japanese War (1894-95)

first of the ten Heavenly Stems 十天干[shi2 tian1 gan1]/(used for an unspecified person or thing)/first (in a list, as a party to a contract etc)/letter "A" or roman "I" in list "A, B, C", or "I, II, III" etc/armor plating/shell or carapace/(of the fingers or toes) nail/bladed leather or metal armor (old)/ranking system used in the Imperial examinations (old)/civil administration unit in the baojia 保甲[bao3 jia3] system (old)/ancient Chinese compass point: 75°
7th earthly branch: 11 a.m.-1 p.m., noon, 5th solar month (6th June-6th July), year of the Horse/ancient Chinese compass point: 180° (south)
to fight/fight/war/battle

sentences.english: In this transformation process, Sino-Japanese War plays an important role.
sentences.chinese: 在這一轉型過程中，甲午戰爭發揮了重要作用。

sentences.english: But the Sino-Japanese War after the increasingly conservative in their thoughts.
sentences.chinese: 但甲午戰爭以後，其思想日趨保守。

sentences.english: In the history of fiction translation from foreign languages to Chinese, the Sino-Japanese War of 1894-1895 was a watershed.
sentences.chinese: 在早期的小說外譯漢史上，甲午戰爭是一個轉折點。

sentences.english: Sino Japanese War of 1894-1895 is an important milestone of the Chinese political culture evolution.
sentences.chinese: 甲午戰爭是中國政治文化演進的重要標界。

sentences.english: The Yellow Sea Battle is regarded as the beginning of the Jiawu Sino-Japanese War.
sentences.chinese: 黃海大戰被認爲是中日甲午戰爭開端。

sentences.english: The third chapter describes that Sheng Xuanhai took the charge of the country hosted the situation after the Sino-Japanese War.
sentences.chinese: 第三章論述盛宣懷在甲午戰爭後主持全國賑務的情況。
